meanings.definition: Drive (a vehicle) too fast for the prevailing conditions.
meanings.sent1: He was overdriving on the icy road, risking a dangerous accident.
meanings.sent2: The driver was overdriving on the highway, ignoring the speed limit.
meanings.sent3: She joked that her friend was overdriving in the parking lot, pretending to be a race car driver.
meanings.sent4: The team captain accused the player of overdriving their performance, leading to mistakes.
meanings.sent5: Overdriving in heavy rain can result in hydroplaning, so it's important to drive cautiously.

meanings.definition: Push (a piece of equipment) beyond its intended limits.
meanings.sent1: The mechanic warned against overdriving the engine, as it could cause damage.
meanings.sent2: By overdriving the generator, he caused it to malfunction.
meanings.sent3: The kids were overdriving the swing set, trying to see who could swing the highest.
meanings.sent4: Overdriving the blender with too many ice cubes may break its blades.
meanings.sent5: The instructions clearly state not to overdrive the drill to avoid overheating.

meanings.sent1: She tends to overdrive her achievements, making them sound more impressive than they are.
meanings.sent2: The salesman was overdriving the benefits of the product to make a sale.
meanings.sent3: He always overdrives his excuses, trying to avoid taking responsibility.
meanings.sent4: The comedian overdrove the punchline, making it less funny than intended.
meanings.sent5: The artist overdrove the colors in the painting, creating a vibrant but unrealistic scene.
